title: Bill Mellor (footballer)
text:
William Gladstone Mellor (3 April 1886 — 21 July 1938) was an English <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who played as a <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>.
Career.
Mellor began his sporting career in <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a>, playing for <a href="Barrow%20Raiders">Barrow</a>. In 1908, Mellor made the switch to football, signing for <a href="Carlisle%20United%20F.C.">Carlisle United</a>. In 1910, Mellor joined <a href="Norwich%20City%20F.C.">Norwich City</a>. In January 1914, Mellor signed for <a href="Newcastle%20United%20F.C.">Newcastle United</a> for a fee of £765. At Newcastle, Mellor made 25 appearances in all competitions, appearing 23 times in the <a href="Football%20League%20First%20Division">First Division</a>. 
Later life and death.
Mellor late emigrated to <a href="New%20Zealand">New Zealand</a> in 1924, before returning to England six years later. On 21 July 1938, Mellor died in <a href="Barrow-in-Furness">Barrow-in-Furness</a>.
